Node.definition: = action by which humans or divine beings express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to (other) humans or deities about who they are and what they do
= short form of יהוה (יהוה) only found in poetic texts
= action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= a group or gathering of persons (like friends or members of the same group) or heavenly beings
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
= a large gathering of humans or creatures ► usually for a specific purpose
= state in which an event has a high intensity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or deities make an intensive effort to obtain in depth information about a certain object or event
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
= state in which humans, deities, animals and plants are respected by others, implying beauty, vigor and authority
= state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= an adverb that specifies unending time
= process in which information that is stored in one's mind regarding someone or something is being reprocessed continually and/or repeatedly

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself
= state in which deities are favorably disposed to someone, or of experiencing an emotion of compassion towards other people, and acting accordingly
= state in which deities feel compassion for humans, ► which is usually translated into action
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= general term for food; ◄ from plants as well as meat; ≈ with no suggestion of aggression involved in obtaining it
= state in which humans experience fear

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
literally: a ruling or decision; hence: = a law or ordinance handed down by a ruler or a deity that a particular group of people is expected to obey
= state in which an event is likely to last for a long time, ≈ which can be either good or bad
= rules regulating behavior
= process by which laws endure for a long period of time
= an adverb that specifies unending time
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= state in which an event is morally and ethically right

Node.gloss: to send|to cause to happen|to stir up
Node.definition: literally: to send; hence: = causative action by which deities cause an event to happen
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well
= state in which humans, deities, places and activities have qualities that inspire fear in others
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= point in time at which an event starts happening
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= state in which humans experience fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of praise
= an adverb that specifies unending time
